snippet: Growth in Mississippi and Virginia fueled by a migration of newcomers from other parts of the country and even abroad is bringing nationalized politics to races further down the ballot.
abstract: Influx of newcomers from other parts of the country to suburban areas in states like Mississippi and Virginia has brought nationalized politics to political races further down the ballot; such voters, who lack local ties and draw their political information from cable news and radio, were key factor in primary defeats of Rep Eric Cantor of Virginia and Sen Thad Cochran of Mississippi.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker reported from Southhaven, and Jonathan Martin from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Growth in Mississippi and Virginia fueled by a migration of newcomers from other parts of the country and even abroad is bringing nationalized politics to races further down the ballot.

headline.main: Population Shifts Turning All Politics National
headline.print_headline: Population Shifts Turning All Politics National
